newsitem.title: UK: Oil price rally hesitates as confidence drains.
newsitem.headline: Oil price rally hesitates as confidence drains.

text.p: Oil prices shifted lower on Thursday as traders' confidence in this week's unexpectedly sharp rally began to slip away.
London May futures for international bellwether North Sea Brent blend closed 13 cents lower at $20.19 a barrel.
Lower prices came in spite of the closure for the second time this week of the Mississippi River to barge traffic, delaying shipments of oil products into the U.S. Midwest.
Dealers in the United States said the closure, after 100 barges broke loose in swollen waters, had proven bearish for oil prices because crude stocks would rise as a result.
European petroleum product traders were looking east to shift a surplus which has kept refining profits in the doldrums over the past month.
"Most oil products are oversupplied in Europe and the United States. The only real demand is in Asia," said an oil market analyst.
Asian traders were looking to soak up European cargoes to take advantage of usually high refinery profit margins, measured at just under $5 a barrel in Singapore on Thursday.
Eastbound oil shipments from the Middle East also have risen sharply this year to feed newly commissioned refineries.
"It looks as though the east has bailed out the west again," said consultancy Oil Movements in a weekly report.
Two European refiners, feeling a little more confident about profits in the past few days, have decided to restore operations after cutting crude throughputs early this month.
But other refiners were putting off a decision, citing profits before fixed costs still at just $1.14 in Rotterdam.
Crude oil prices in dollars per barrel:
